text: There's no way to know for sure
if your number has been blocked,

but these steps will help you
narrow down the possibilities
if you're using an iPhone.
First, try to send out a courteous text

to the person you believe
may have blocked you.
If the text shows up as "Delivered,"
you can be sure that you were not blocked.

However, if you see the
alert "Not Delivered"

or if you don't see any
delivery verification at all,
it could mean that you've been blocked.
If you try calling them
and the call goes straight to voicemail,

that, too, could mean
that you've been blocked.
Voicemail: Your call has been forwarded
to an automated voice-messaging system.
Narrator: But there are some reasons

why you may not be able
to get through to someone,

and it doesn't necessarily mean
that you have been blocked.
It could be that their phone is turned off
or out of service range.

This would also happen if
they've turned on airplane mode
or do not disturb.

The most certain way to
tell if you've been blocked

is to mask your number
before calling them.
To do this, open your phone application,
then type *67,

then the phone number of the
person you're trying to reach.
If it rings through normally
or the person answers,

odds are likely that you've
been blocked by them.
